operations.name: unauthorize
operations.description: Deletes all the access token information of a given resource owner id so that it's impossible to execute any operation for that user without doing the authorization dance again

parameters.name: reconnection
parameters.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

description.value: A pooling profile is used to configure the pooling behaviour of Mule components. Each component can have its own pooling profile.

Controls the maximum number of Mule components that can be borrowed from a session at one time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of components that may be active at one time. When maxActive is exceeded, the pool is said to be exhausted.

Controls the maximum number of Mule components that can sit idle in the pool at any time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of Mule components that may be idle at one time.
Specifies the number of milliseconds to wait for a pooled component to become available when the pool is exhausted and the exhaustedAction is set to WHEN_EXHAUSTED_WAIT.
Determines the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction. When non-positive, no objects will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.
Specifies the number of milliseconds between runs of the object evictor. When non-positive, no object evictor is executed.

Specifies the behavior of the Mule component pool when the pool is exhausted. Possible values are: "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_FAIL", which will throw a NoSuchElementException, "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_WAIT", which will block by invoking Object.wait(long) until a new or idle object is available, or WHEN_EXHAUSTED_GROW, which will create a new Mule instance and return it, essentially making maxActive meaningless. If a positive maxWait value is supplied, it will block for at most that many milliseconds, after which a NoSuchElementException will be thrown. If maxThreadWait is a negative value, it will block indefinitely.

Determines how components in a pool should be initialized. The possible values are: INITIALISE_NONE (will not load any components into the pool on startup), INITIALISE_ONE (will load one initial component into the pool on startup), or INITIALISE_ALL (will load all components in the pool on startup)
Whether pooling should be disabled

parameters.name: poolingProfile
parameters.description: Characteristics of the connection pool

parameters.name: consumerKey
parameters.description: The OAuth consumerKey as registered with the service provider

parameters.name: consumerSecret
parameters.description: The OAuth consumerSecret as registered with the service provider

parameters.name: authorizationUrl
parameters.description: The service provider's authorization endpoint URL

parameters.name: accessTokenUrl
parameters.description: The service provider's accessToken endpoint URL

parameters.name: scopes
parameters.description: The OAuth scopes to be requested during the dance. If not provided, it will default to those in the annotation

parameters.name: resourceOwnerId
parameters.description: The resourceOwnerId which each component should use if it doesn't reference otherwise.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The name of a flow to be executed right before starting the OAuth dance

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The name of a flow to be executed right after an accessToken has been received

parameters.name: listenerConfig
parameters.description: A reference to a <http:listener-config /> to be used in order to create the listener that will catch the access token callback endpoint.

parameters.name: callbackPath
parameters.description: The path of the access token callback endpoint

parameters.name: authorizePath
parameters.description: The path of the local http endpoint which triggers the OAuth dance

parameters.name: externalCallbackUrl
parameters.description: If the callback endpoint is behind a proxy or should be accessed through a non direct URL, use this parameter to tell the OAuth provider the URL it should use to access the callback

parameters.name: objectStore
parameters.description: A reference to the object store that should be used to store each resource owner id's data. If not specified, runtime will automatically provision the default one.
